Limited budget: Filming a documentary can be expensive, especially if it involves travel or specialized equipment. Finding ways to stay within budget without compromising on quality is a common problem.
Unpredictable subjects: Subjects may not be willing to cooperate or may change their availability at the last minute, which can cause delays and disrupt the filming schedule.
Technical issues: Equipment malfunctions, power outages, or other technical problems can occur during filming, causing delays and potential loss of footage.
Legal restrictions: Clearing the rights to use copyrighted material, obtaining permission to film in certain locations, and ensuring compliance with laws and regulations can be challenging.

Post-production challenges: Assembling footage, editing, and sound design can be time-consuming and require specialized skills. Meeting deadlines and ensuring a polished final product can be difficult.
